page.title: 01Cape Cornwall
page.content: Cape Cornwall is 15-20 minutes walk west of St Just. About a mile from the shore are two huge rocks known as The Brisons which were the cause of many shipwrecks in the past. An arduous swim from the shore to the rocks is an annual event in July. Below the Cape is a cove which shelters a terrace of cottages formerly used by coastguards. Today the Coastguard Lookout is only used on occasions of "Casualty Risk Watch"- perhaps during severe weather. From the top of the Cape there is a magnificent view of the rolling Atlantic. The top of the Cape is marked by a reminder of the once thriving tin industry - a derelict 19th century mine ventilation shaft. Many artists from all over the world are drawn to this part of the coast because of the extraordinary "Atlantic light".....................Beautiful!!
